events.title: California Women's Basketball vs Louisville - National Girls and Women In Sports Day
events.description: Cheer on the California Women's Basketball team as they face Louisville, celebrating National Girls and Women In Sports Day. Join the campus community in supporting student-athletes.

events.title: California Men's Tennis vs UCLA
events.description: Watch the California Men's Tennis team compete against UCLA in a spirited collegiate match. Support the Golden Bears on their home court.

events.title: California Men's Tennis vs UC Davis
events.description: Catch the California Men's Tennis team in action as they play against UC Davis. This match is a great opportunity to see top collegiate tennis.

events.title: Sick Plant Clinic
events.description: Bring your ailing plants to the monthly Sick Plant Clinic for expert diagnosis and advice from garden volunteers. Learn how to combat diseases and pests affecting your plants.

events.title: Classical Concert in the Florilegium with Left Coast Chamber Ensemble
events.description: Enjoy a special noon concert featuring the Left Coast Chamber Ensemble in the beautiful setting of Julia Morgan Hall. Experience classical music in an intimate environment.

events.title: Film Screening – “The Phantom Carriage”
events.description: Experience a new digital restoration of Ingmar Bergman's classic, 'The Phantom Carriage,' an inventive film about an alcoholic's encounter with the Grim Reaper. Includes an introduction by Professor Linda Haverty Rugg and live piano accompaniment.

events.title: Steven Banks and Xak Bjerken: Golden Silhouettes
events.description: Saxophonist Steven Banks, winner of the Avery Fisher Career Grant, makes his Cal Performances debut with pianist Xak Bjerken. The recital features works by American composers and cello showpieces.

events.title: Film Screening – “Robert Beavers: Program 4”
events.description: Explore three films from Robert Beavers's film cycle, creating connections between varied times and places, and old-world artisanal practices and filmmaking. A conversation with Robert Beavers and Erik Ulman follows the screening.

events.title: Film Screening – ” 2046”
events.description: A 4K Digital Restoration screening of Wong Kar Wai's '2046,' echoing 'In the Mood For Love' and exploring themes of memory. This film is a compelling cinematic experience.

events.title: Robert Beavers: Program 7
events.description: Screening of Robert Beavers's works exploring poetic form, emotions tied to home, and delicate portraits. The program includes 'Pitcher of Colored Light' and 'The Suppliant'.

events.title: Eco Ensemble; David Milnes, director
events.description: UC Berkeley's Eco Ensemble, directed by David Milnes, performs works by two recent additions to the composition faculty. This concert showcases contemporary classical music.

events.title: Joyce DiDonato, mezzo-soprano; Time for Three, string trio: Emily – No Prisoner Be
events.description: Mezzo-soprano Joyce DiDonato partners with Grammy-winning string trio Time for Three for a program exploring the poetry of Emily Dickinson. A captivating evening of vocal and instrumental artistry.

events.title: Silicon Valley Start-up & Investor Week
events.description: An exclusive investment and market-entry program for high-potential technology and deep-tech startups. Engage with venture capital, corporate innovation teams, and global partners.

events.title: Discovery Station: Newts
events.description: Drop in to the Discovery Station where volunteer docents provide information and an up-close look at newts. A fun and educational experience for all ages.

events.title: Open: Art Lab
events.description: The Fisher Family Art Lab welcomes visitors of all ages to explore their creativity through hands-on art-making activities. This drop-in event is included with museum admission.

events.title: Symposium / Multiple Offerings: New Directions in Research on Theresa Hak Kyung Cha
events.description: BAMPFA hosts a symposium highlighting new research directions on Theresa Hak Kyung Cha, featuring contributions from graduate students and early career researchers. Moderated by UC Berkeley faculty.

events.title: Light Catcher Workshop
events.description: Participate in a hands-on workshop to create light catchers, exploring light and art. This creative activity is suitable for various skill levels.

events.title: CrafterDark at Anchor House
events.description: Join a weekly craft session for free crafting and art making. This is an excellent opportunity to relax, create, and socialize with fellow students.

events.title: International Conference on Big Data and Data Science
events.description: A conference focusing on recent advances and discussions in the fields of Big Data and Data Science. Connect with experts and researchers in the computing domain.

events.title: "Who's Flying This Thing?" Thoughts on U.S. Military Action in Venezuela, the “Donroe” Doctrine, and U.S. Relations With Latin America
events.location: 223 Philosophy Hall, Institute of International Studies
events.description: A public lecture discussing the intricacies of U.S. military involvement in Venezuela, the 'Donroe' Doctrine, and its impact on Latin American relations.

events.title: Dr. Kevin Bustamante: The Myth of Nuclear Prestige
events.description: Dr. Kevin Bustamante presents his research on the perceived role of nuclear weapons as international status symbols. This public event will delve into the complexities of nuclear politics.

events.title: Choco-love Extravaganza!
events.description: Join STEM*FYI for a delightful evening of chocolate-covered fruits and snacks, dinner, and board games, just in time for Valentine's. All graduate students are welcome.

events.title: EM&V Forum
events.description: A pivotal platform addressing critical issues related to Evaluation, Measurement, and Verification (EM&V) in the energy sector.

events.title: Bruce Liu, piano
events.description: 2021 International Chopin Piano Competition winner Bruce Liu makes his Cal Performances debut. The program includes works by Chopin, Beethoven, and other renowned composers.

events.title: Environmental and Energy Economics Seminar – Diego Kanzig, Northwestern University
events.description: A seminar featuring Diego Kanzig from Northwestern University, discussing topics in environmental and energy economics. Title and specific time to be announced.

events.title: Introducing the Agentic AI Risk Management Profile
events.organizer: UC Berkeley School of Information / CLTC
events.description: A seminar introducing the Agentic AI Risk Management Profile, focusing on new approaches to managing risks associated with advanced AI systems.

events.title: Making Sense of the World through Language and Stories: A Digital Humanities Perspective with Michaela Mahlberg
events.description: Michaela Mahlberg, a corpus linguist, explores language as a social phenomenon and its role in shaping our understanding of the world from a digital humanities perspective.

events.title: Venezuela in Context: A Q&A on Policy and the US Military
events.description: In partnership with Professor Dorothy Kronick, this Q&A session aims to deepen understanding of current developments in Venezuela by examining historical political institutions and policy implications.

events.title: Focus On Local and State Government: Master of Public Affairs (MPA) Information Session
events.description: An information session for prospective students interested in the Master of Public Affairs program, with a focus on careers in local and state government.

events.title: Integral Taiji and Qigong
events.description: Join a Friday late morning Integral Taiji & Qigong class to improve balance, flexibility, and mindfulness. Register to participate in this invigorating session.

events.title: Discussion with Michaela Mahlberg
events.description: An in-person, collaborative deep dive with Bellwether Lecturer Michaela Mahlberg, following her earlier lecture on digital humanities and language.

events.title: Symbiosis & Cocktails: Lichen Love
events.description: A pre-Valentine's cocktail hour celebrating symbiosis in the plant world, focusing on lichen. Enjoy drinks and learn about this fascinating natural phenomenon.

events.title: 2026 Cal Invitational Speech and Debate Tournament
events.description: A major speech and debate tournament featuring various in-person and online divisions. Students compete in events such as Policy Debate, Lincoln-Douglas, and Public Forum.

events.title: Martha Graham Dance Company: GRAHAM100
events.description: The iconic Martha Graham Dance Company returns to Cal Performances to celebrate its 100th anniversary with classic and new works.

events.title: FAMILY PROGRAM: Botanical Valentine's Tea (Morning Session)
events.description: An annual family tradition, enjoy a lovely botanical tea in honor of Valentine's Day. This is a morning session for families to celebrate and connect with nature.

events.title: FAMILY PROGRAM: Botanical Valentine's Tea (Afternoon Session)
events.description: The annual family Botanical Valentine's Tea continues with an afternoon session. Enjoy a festive and floral celebration with activities suitable for the whole family.

events.title: Martha Graham Dance Company: GRAHAM100
events.description: The Martha Graham Dance Company celebrates its 100th anniversary with a matinee performance of Graham classics.

events.title: Discovery Station: Newts
events.description: A second opportunity to drop in to the Discovery Station for an up-close look at newts and learn from volunteer docents.

events.title: Traffic Safety Innovation Summit
events.organizer: Swedish-American Chamber of Commerce SF & Silicon Valley
events.description: A premier event focusing on innovation in traffic safety, hosted at the Richmond Field Station. This summit brings together experts in automotive and logistics.

events.title: A.I.M by Kyle Abraham
events.description: Kyle Abraham brings his A.I.M company to Cal Performances, debuting three works exploring the intersection of Black and queer culture through dance.

events.title: Somi
events.description: Vocalist and composer Somi makes her Cal Performances debut, presenting music that bridges African and U.S. cultures.

events.title: A.I.M by Kyle Abraham (Matinee)
events.description: A matinee performance by Kyle Abraham's A.I.M company, showcasing innovative dance works at the intersection of Black and queer culture.

events.title: Canto Ostinato, An AMOC* & Sandbox Percussion Co-Production
events.description: The American Modern Opera Company and Sandbox Percussion perform Simeon ten Holt's minimalist masterpiece 'Canto Ostinato'.

events.title: Takács Quartet
events.description: The Takács Quartet performs the premiere of a new work by Clarice Assad, alongside compositions by Haydn and Debussy.

events.title: Energy Markets Workshop – Speaker and title forthcoming
events.description: An upcoming Energy Markets Workshop with a speaker and topic to be announced. This series connects academics and industry professionals in energy economics.

events.title: Environmental and Energy Economics Seminar – Lint Barrage, ETH Zürich
events.description: Lint Barrage from ETH Zürich presents research in environmental and energy economics. Details about the specific title and time will be announced.

events.title: Plein AiR Patrol with Forest Stearns
events.description: Join Forest Stearns for a 'Plein AiR Patrol' session, combining art and nature in the botanical garden. Explore outdoor art-making and environmental observation.

events.title: Chris Thile, mandolin and vocals
events.description: MacArthur Fellow and Grammy-winner Chris Thile returns to Berkeley, performing original songs and classical interpretations on mandolin and vocals.

events.title: Yaa Samar! Dance Theatre: Gathering
events.description: Yaa Samar! Dance Theatre presents 'Gathering,' exploring themes of love, loss, trauma, and dislocation through movement, text, song, and puppetry.

events.title: Member Event: Member Morning
events.description: An exclusive morning event for garden members, offering special access and activities within the beautiful UC Botanical Garden.

events.title: Garden Shop Spring Clearance Sale
events.description: Browse and purchase discounted botanical items, plants, and garden-related products at the annual Spring Clearance Sale.

events.title: Yaa Samar! Dance Theatre: Gathering (Matinee)
events.description: A matinee performance of 'Gathering' by Yaa Samar! Dance Theatre, exploring themes of love, loss, trauma, and dislocation.

events.title: Yaa Samar! Dance Theatre: Gathering (Evening)
events.description: An evening performance of 'Gathering' by Yaa Samar! Dance Theatre, a profound exploration of human experience through dance.

events.title: Geneva Lewis, violin; Evren Ozel, piano
events.description: Violinist Geneva Lewis and pianist Evren Ozel perform a program of Bach, Schumann, Schoenberg, and Schubert.

events.title: Yaa Samar! Dance Theatre: Gathering
events.description: The final performance of Yaa Samar! Dance Theatre's 'Gathering,' a powerful and moving dance work.

events.title: ACM Symposium on Computer Science and Law
events.description: A premier conference dedicated to the interdisciplinary field merging computing technology with legal scholarship. The symposium serves as a platform for scholars in both fields.

events.title: Emma Lurie on online harms in platform design, regulatory structures, and expert discourse
events.description: Emma Lurie discusses the origins of online harms within platform design, regulatory frameworks, and expert discussions. This talk offers critical insights into digital policy.

events.title: Environmental and Energy Economics Seminar – Tatyana Deryugina, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
events.description: Tatyana Deryugina presents her work on environmental and energy economics. This seminar is part of an ongoing series connecting academics and industry professionals.

events.title: Bob L. T. Sturm on MUSAiC project
events.description: Bob L. T. Sturm, associate professor at KTH Royal Institute of Technology, discusses the MUSAiC project, exploring musical AI and computational creativity.

events.title: Discussion with Bob L. T. Sturm
events.description: An in-person, collaborative deep dive with Cultural Analytics speaker Bob L. T. Sturm, following his presentation on the MUSAiC project.

events.title: Julia Keefe Indigenous Big Band
events.description: The Julia Keefe Indigenous Big Band celebrates and extends the contributions of Native American artists throughout jazz history.

events.title: Berkeley Model United Nations (BMUN)
events.description: One of the oldest and most prestigious Model UN conferences in the world, bringing together high school students for engaging debate and diplomacy.

events.title: Algorithmic Music Methods Conference
events.description: A conference exploring various algorithmic methods in music composition, analysis, and performance. This event brings together researchers and practitioners in music technology.

events.title: Charlie Chaplin's The Kid; Marc Ribot, guitar
events.description: Guitarist Marc Ribot provides a distinctive live score for a special screening of Charlie Chaplin's 1921 classic, 'The Kid'.

events.title: The English Concert: Handel's Hercules; Harry Bicket, conductor
events.description: Harry Bicket leads The English Concert in Handel's 'Hercules,' a stunning performance by the renowned British early-music ensemble.

events.title: International Conference on Machine Learning and Chat GPT
events.description: A conference dedicated to advancements in Machine Learning and the applications of Chat GPT. Engage with leading experts in AI and computational linguistics.

events.title: Opera Parallèle: La Belle et la Bête by Philip Glass
events.description: An original presentation merging Jean Cocteau's 1946 film with Philip Glass's mesmerizing 1994 score. Nicole Paiement conducts this unique operatic experience.

events.title: Opera Parallèle: La Belle et la Bête by Philip Glass (Second Performance)
events.description: A second opportunity to experience Opera Parallèle's acclaimed multimedia production of Philip Glass's 'La Belle et la Bête.'

events.title: Empowering Womxn of Color Conference (ewocc)
events.description: A conference dedicated to empowering womxn of color, featuring discussions, workshops, and networking opportunities.

events.title: JACK Quartet
events.description: The JACK Quartet makes their Cal Performances debut, featuring premieres by Juri Seo and Anthony Cheung, and songs by Hans Abrahamsen and Helmut Lachenmann.

events.title: Energy Markets Workshop – Will Gorman, LBNL, “'Energy-Only' Interconnection Service: A Review of Current Practice and Considerations for its Future”
events.description: Will Gorman from LBNL discusses 'Energy-Only' Interconnection Service, reviewing current practices and future considerations in energy markets.

events.title: Gesamtkunstvektoren: Perceptual Embeddings for the Performing Arts, Peter Broadwell
events.description: Peter Broadwell explores new opportunities for using deep neural models for computational analyses of theater and other performing arts.

events.title: Graph Cities and their Applications, James Abello & Haoyang Zhang
events.description: James Abello & Haoyang Zhang present Graph Cities, a novel visualization for exploring complex large-scale networks and their applications.

events.title: Cultural Analytics Workshop with Lauren Tilton
events.description: Lauren Tilton's workshop focuses on applying digital and computational methods to the study of 20th and 21st century documentary expression and visual culture.

events.title: Computational Approaches to Pacing and Style in Television Comedy, Taylor Arnold
events.description: Taylor Arnold analyzes how television production practices and narrative strategies intersect with industry changes and cultural contexts using large-scale computational methods.

events.title: Silkroad Ensemble with Rhiannon Giddens: Sanctuary: The Power of Resonance and Ritual
events.description: The Silkroad Ensemble and Rhiannon Giddens unite for a performance that encourages audience reflection and cross-cultural conversation.

events.title: The Social Foundations of Creative Influence, Noah Askin
events.description: Noah Askin, a computational social scientist and sociologist, studies the creative process, its outcomes, and the forces that influence it.

events.title: The Three Obstructions: Improvements in Analysis & Interface for Multimodal Retrieval, Peter Leonard
events.description: Peter Leonard itemizes three barriers that hinder analysis of film and television, presenting improvements for multimodal retrieval.

events.title: POWER Conference on Energy Research and Policy
events.location: Spieker Forum, Haas School of Business
events.description: An intense research environment connecting academics, government organizations, and industry professionals interested in energy economics. This annual conference covers key policy and research topics.

events.title: What Dance Scholars can Learn from Warehouse Surveillance: Emic Approaches to Temporal Action Segmentation, Miguel Escobar Varela
events.description: Miguel Escobar Varela explores insights for dance scholars from warehouse surveillance, applying computational methods to cultural heritage.

events.title: Cultural Analytics Workshop Week: Conclusion & Reflections
events.description: The concluding session and reflections for the Cultural Analytics Workshop Week, summarizing key learnings and discussions from the week's events.

events.title: Silkroad Ensemble with Rhiannon Giddens: Sanctuary: The Power of Resonance and Ritual
events.description: A second performance by the Silkroad Ensemble and Rhiannon Giddens, fostering cultural dialogue through music and performance.

events.title: Drum Tao: The Best
events.description: The taiko drummers of Drum Tao return to Berkeley with their acclaimed performance, showcasing centuries-old drumming traditions and dazzling choreography.

events.title: Drum Tao: The Best (Matinee)
events.description: A matinee performance by Drum Tao, delivering powerful taiko drumming and dynamic choreography.

events.title: Théotime Langlois de Swarte, violin; Justin Taylor, harpsichord
events.description: Violinist Théotime Langlois de Swarte and harpsichordist Justin Taylor return to Cal Performances for a thrilling program of Baroque showpieces.

events.title: JOIM Spring Conference
events.description: The Journal of Investment Management (JOIM) Spring Conference brings together leading academics and practitioners to discuss cutting-edge research in investment management.

events.title: Music in the Schools Luncheon
events.description: Annual fundraising luncheon supporting Berkeley Symphony's expansive music programs in local schools, reaching thousands of students.

events.title: The Bioneers Conference
events.description: A conference focused on breakthrough solutions for restoring nature and people. Bioneers brings together diverse leaders and thinkers in environmental and social justice.

events.title: David Finckel, cello; Wu Han, piano
events.description: Cellist David Finckel and pianist Wu Han return to Berkeley to perform works by Bach, John Corigliano, Debussy, Chopin, and Britten.

events.title: International Conference on Big Data Computer Science and Information
events.description: A conference focusing on the latest research and developments in Big Data, Computer Science, and Information Technology.

events.title: Berkeley-Stanford Graduate Student Conference in Modern Chinese Humanities
events.organizer: Center for Chinese Studies, UC Berkeley
events.description: A conference for graduate students to present research on modern Chinese humanities, with a keynote speaker and alumni keynote.

events.title: Writing With and Beyond AI: Fieldnotes from Computer-Mediated Poetry, Kyle Booten
events.description: Kyle Booten explores the use of large language models in poetry, discussing how to write with AI to create unique and impactful works.

events.title: Discussion with Kyle Booten
events.description: An in-person, collaborative deep dive with Cultural Analytics speaker Kyle Booten, following his presentation on computer-mediated poetry.

events.title: Berkeley mini Math Tournament
events.description: A math competition for middle school students, featuring puzzle, individual, team, and relay rounds.

events.title: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater
events.description: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater returns for its annual Berkeley residency, embodying the vision of its founder through performances of power, beauty, and grace.

events.title: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater (Second Performance)
events.description: A second evening performance by the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, showcasing their dynamic repertoire.

events.title: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater (Third Performance)
events.description: Another opportunity to witness the power and grace of the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater.

events.title: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater (Fourth Performance)
events.description: An evening performance by the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, continuing their annual residency in Berkeley.

events.title: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater (Matinee)
events.description: A matinee performance by the renowned Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater.

events.title: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater (Evening)
events.description: An evening performance by the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, showcasing their iconic repertoire.

events.title: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater (Final Performance)
events.description: The final performance of the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater's annual Berkeley residency.

events.title: The Joffrey Ballet: Midsummer Night's Dream
events.description: The Joffrey Ballet returns to Cal Performances with Alexander Ekman's signature blockbuster work, 'Midsummer Night's Dream.'

events.title: The Joffrey Ballet: Midsummer Night's Dream (Second Performance)
events.description: A second opportunity to see The Joffrey Ballet perform 'Midsummer Night's Dream.'

events.title: The Joffrey Ballet: Midsummer Night's Dream (Matinee)
events.description: A matinee performance of The Joffrey Ballet's 'Midsummer Night's Dream.'

events.title: Jordi Savall; La Capella Reial de Catalunya; Hespèrion XXI; Tembembe Ensamble Continuo: Un Mar de Músicas
events.description: Jordi Savall and his ensembles honor those enslaved by Western nations with a performance titled 'Un Mar de Músicas' (A Sea of Music).

events.title: Alexandre Kantorow, piano
events.description: French pianist Alexandre Kantorow makes his Cal Performances debut with a program featuring Bach, Chopin, Beethoven, Scriabin, and Medtner.

events.title: The Tallis Scholars: Mysteries and Miracles
events.description: The Tallis Scholars present an Easter season program inspired by events in the biblical story of Jesus' life.

events.title: Víkingur Ólafsson, piano: Opus 109
events.description: 2025–26 Artist in Residence pianist Víkingur Ólafsson returns to Berkeley with a recital featuring Beethoven, Bach and Schubert.

events.title: Renée Fleming, soprano; Inon Barnatan, piano
events.description: Grammy-winning soprano Renée Fleming returns to Cal Performances, accompanied by pianist Inon Barnatan, performing a program of songs, arias, and piano showpieces.

events.title: Lara Downes and Friends: This Land: Reflections on America
events.description: Pianist Lara Downes is joined by an all-star cast of collaborators for a program exploring the richness and complexity of the American experience.

events.title: School of Information 2026 Commencement
events.description: Honor the class of 2026 with a keynote speaker, student speakers, and student awards at the School of Information's commencement ceremony.
